page.title: 10STONEY STREET
page.content: The Roman Road known locally as{Stone} or{Stoney Street}was part of the route from{Isca}(Caerleon) to{Uriconium} (Wroxeter).Where the road crossed the{ {River Wye},just before the Roman town of{Magna}(Kenchester),the Romans may have built a wooden bridge. Today the road is divided in two by the{B4352 Hereford to Madley}road,the two sections are very different.The southern section starts off narrow with high hedges but when it crosses the site of the old{wartime airfield} it widens and the land is more open with few high hedges and it is fairly level.The northern section is narrow with high hedges and climbs steadily to just where it leaves the present day road to cut down over fields to the{River Wye.}
